Rulings.Base:
1. The Normal Summon you gain from this effect must be a Summon in Attack Position. You cannot Set.
2. "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" must be face-up on the field when you attempt the extra Summon.
3. If the effect of "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" is being negated, you cannot Normal Summon the extra monster.
4. You cannot gain more than 1 extra Summon from "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar", even if you Summon another "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" with the extra Summon granted by the first one.
5. If you activate "Double Summon" while you're able to Summon an extra monster due to the effect of "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar", you still gain the effect of "Double Summon". Make sure to clarify which extra Summon you're using if this happens.
6. You cannot Normal Summon an extra monster with the effect of "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" if you Normal Summon "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" during your opponent's turn with "Ultimate Offering", but if your opponent gains control of "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" afterwards, he can perform the extra Summon.
7. If "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" is Normal Summoned, then flipped face-down and face-up in the same turn, you can still Summon an extra monster.
8. The effect to add a 'Nordic Relic' to your hand targets.
9. If this card is attacked while face-down and destroyed, you cannot add a 'Nordic Relic' to your hand.
10. If "Dverg of the Nordic Alfar" is flipped face-up by "Acid Trap Hole" and destroyed, you can add a 'Nordic Relic' to your hand.

PSCT.Base: After you Normal Summon this card, you can Normal Summon 1 "Nordic" monster during your Main Phase this turn, in addition to your Normal Summon/Set. (You can only gain this effect once per turn.) If this face-up card on the field is sent to the GY: Target 1 "Nordic Relic" card in your GY; add that target to your hand.
